src.preprocessing package

src.preprocessing.preprocessing_utils module

src.preprocessing.preprocessing_utils.convert_sentiment_df(df: DataFrame, src_col: str = 'Sentiment', dst_col: str = 'sentiment') → DataFrame[source]

Convert sentiments in a given dataframe from string format (‘positive’ and ‘negative’) to integer format (1 and 0)

Parameters:

  • df (pd.Dataframe) – input dataframe with sentiment column

  • src_col (str) – column name of input sentiment column

  • dst_col (str) – expected column name of output sentiment column

Returns:

dataframe consisting of sentiment column where entries are in binary integer format (1 and 0)

Return type:

df (pd.Dataframe)

  • expande (contractions) –

Returns:

df (pd.Dataframe)

src.preprocessing.preprocessing_utils.expand_contractions_text(text: str) → str[source]

Returns:

src.preprocessing.preprocessing_utils.remove_stopwords_text(text: str) → str[source]

Removes stopwords in a string Stopwords are obtained from nltk.corpus e.g.: the, a, is, had, etc

Parameters:

text (str) – text containing stopwords

Returns:

text with stopwords removed

Return type:

output_text (str)

Removes trailing leading spaces in a text column of dataframe. e.g. ” The food was good” -> “The food was good”

Parameters:

  • src_col (str) – column name of input text column

  • dst_col (str) – column name of output text column with trailing

  • removed (leading spaces) –

Returns:

dataframe consisting of text column with trailing leading spaces removed

Return type:

df (pd.Dataframe)

src.preprocessing.preprocessing_utils.strip_html_tags_df(df: DataFrame, src_col: str = 'cleaned_text', dst_col: str = 'cleaned_text') → DataFrame[source]

Removes HTML tags in a text column of dataframe. e.g. “<p>The food was good</p><br>” -> “The food was good”

Parameters:

  • src_col (str) – column name of input text column

  • dst_col (str) – column name of output text column with

  • removed (HTML tags) –

Returns:

dataframe consisting of text column with HTML tags removed

Return type:

df (pd.Dataframe)

src.preprocessing.transformations module

src.preprocessing.transformations.apply_cleaning_test(df: DataFrame) → DataFrame[source]

Applies cleaning to test data as follows: 1. Removes HTML tags, multiple spaces and trailing leading spaces to form partially_cleaned_text column. 2. Removes HTML tags, multiple spaces, trailing leading spaces, stopwords and numbers. Lowercases text, expands contractions and removes empty reviews to form cleaned_text column. 3. Renames Time column to date

Parameters:

df (pd.Dataframe) – input dataframe with columns Text and Time

Returns:

dataframe consisting of new text columns partially_cleaned_text and cleaned_text.

Return type:

df (pd.Dataframe)

src.preprocessing.transformations.apply_cleaning_train(df: DataFrame) → DataFrame[source]

Applies cleaning to training data as follows: 1. Converts sentiment column to binary integer format 2. Removes HTML tags, multiple spaces and trailing leading spaces to form partially_cleaned_text column. 3. Removes HTML tags, multiple spaces, trailing leading spaces, stopwords and numbers. Lowercases text, expands contractions and removes empty reviews to form cleaned_text column. 4. Renames Time column to date

Parameters:

  • df (pd.Dataframe) – input dataframe with columns Text,

  • Time (Sentiment and) –

Returns:

dataframe consisting of new text columns partially_cleaned_text and cleaned_text.

Return type:

df (pd.Dataframe)

src.preprocessing.transformations.preprocess_train()[source]

Applies cleaning to raw training data in according to filepath specified in FileUtil module. Saves processed training data to filepath specified in FileUtil module.
